{"step_by_step_thinking": "Locally advanced breast cancer is defined as a cancer that is large and/or has infiltrated into adjacent tissues (the overlying skin or underlying muscles) and/or are found to have extensive locoregional lymph node involvement. Therefore, a tumor more than 4cm, chest wall involvement, and skin involvement can all be characteristics of locally advanced breast cancer. Inflammatory breast cancer, on the other hand, is a distinct type of breast cancer characterized by swollen, red areas formed on the top of the breast. It is not classified as locally advanced breast cancer, but rather as a separate entity.", "answer_choice": "B"}
